description: If Bill Bryson were to join a Winnipeg funeral home as an apprentice, and if he searched for the meaning of life and death while he was at it, you'd have "Curtains" - enlightening, full of life in the midst of death, and very funny.  At forty-four Tom Jokinen began to seriously question the secular funeral rites that are taking over the industry: is this really the way we want to say our final goodbyes? The question had such a hard grip on his Finnish soul that he decided to quit his job in order to become an apprentice undertaker. "Curtains" is about what he found, from the mundane to the macabre. "Curtains" lifts the veil on the funeral industry in the 21st century.
